           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>OS:<span class="line"><!---->OS:<!----></span><br>Ubuntu 22.04<span class="line"><!---->Ubuntu 22.04<!----></span><br>Version 103.0.5042.0 (Official Build) dev (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Version 103.0.5042.0 (Official Build) dev (64-bit)<!----></span><br><br>This issue is not  stable to repro with chrome asan version. <span class="line"><!---->This issue is not  stable to repro with chrome asan version. <!----></span><br>So,I  tested with non asan version. It will crash  about 30 ~ 60 seconds.<span class="line"><!---->So,I  tested with non asan version. It will crash  about 30 ~ 60 seconds.<!----></span><br><br>1.google-chrome --use-fake-device-for-media-stream    --js-flags=--expose-gc --use-fake-ui-for-media-stream --user-data-dir=/tmp/xx67         Due to an issue with the monorail wizard workflow, this issue was not originally labeled as a security bug and, therefore, this issue did not make it to the security team bug queue for triage. This wizard workflow issue was just discovered today, updating accordingly now. <span class="line"><!---->Due to an issue with the monorail wizard workflow, this issue was not originally labeled as a security bug and, therefore, this issue did not make it to the security team bug queue for triage. This wizard workflow issue was just discovered today, updating accordingly now. <!----></span><br><br>Tentatively setting these and others as security bugs for general tracking purposes and to go into actual security triage; however, there is no indication that this issue results in security consequences nor has it yet been evaluated for such.<span class="line"><!---->Tentatively setting these and others as security bugs for general tracking purposes and to go into actual security triage; however, there is no indication that this issue results in security consequences nor has it yet been evaluated for such.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Apologies for the delay; I was unexpectedly away from work.<span class="line"><!---->Apologies for the delay; I was unexpectedly away from work.<!----></span><br><br>Unfortunately the repro from the bug description (or from <span class="line"><!---->Unfortunately the repro from the bug description (or from <!----></span>comment #25<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c25"><!---->comment #25<!----></a>) is not reliable enough to make into a test, so I will need to rely on manual testing. I have also not succeeded in reproducing the issue in a unit test.<span class="line"><!---->) is not reliable enough to make into a test, so I will need to rely on manual testing. I have also not succeeded in reproducing the issue in a unit test.<!----></span><br><br>Aside from hitting some DCHECKs in various other places in Chromium, the repro causes the worker thread's heap to be destroyed while the main thread still believes that the transferred source is alive. After discussing with mlippautz@, it seems like we can fix this by clearing host_->transferred_source_ in TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource::ContextDestroyed(). I'll have to check if this is a valid fix.<span class="line"><!---->Aside from hitting some DCHECKs in various other places in Chromium, the repro causes the worker thread's heap to be destroyed while the main thread still believes that the transferred source is alive. After discussing with mlippautz@, it seems like we can fix this by clearing host_-&gt;transferred_source_ in TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource::ContextDestroyed(). I'll have to check if this is a valid fix.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Yes, I also tried to use the repro in <span class="line"><!---->Yes, I also tried to use the repro in <!----></span>bug 1337806<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1337806" title="Security:  Google Chrome WebCodecs GetRealmRunner use of uninitialized pointer vulnerability - TALOS-2022-1543"><!---->bug 1337806<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>but it is also not reliable. If left running for long enough, both the repro in this bug and the one in <span class="line"><!---->but it is also not reliable.         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb"><!---->63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb<!----></a><br>Author: Ben Wagner <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Ben Wagner &lt;<!----></span>benjaminwagner@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/benjaminwagner@google.com"><!---->benjaminwagner@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Aug 31 09:23:46 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Aug 31 09:23:46 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fix races in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource related to CrossThreadPersistent<span class="line"><!---->Fix races in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource related to CrossThreadPersistent<!----></span><br><br>The repro in <span class="line"><!---->The repro in <!----></span>bug 1323488<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1323488" title="memeory corruption in frame_queue_underlying_source.cc"><!---->bug 1323488<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>unfortunately does not reliably reproduce<span class="line"><!---->unfortunately does not reliably reproduce<!----></span><br>the races when run as a web test. I was also not able to repro the<span class="line"><!---->the races when run as a web test. I was also not able to repro the<!----></span><br>races in a unit test.<span class="line"><!---->races in a unit test.<!----></span><br><br>There are actually three fixes in this CL; it was easiest to fix them<span class="line"><!---->There are actually three fixes in this CL; it was easiest to fix them<!----></span><br>all together so that I can run the repro locally for an extended period<span class="line"><!---->all together so that I can run the repro locally for an extended period<!----></span><br>without it being stopped by a crash.<span class="line"><!---->without it being stopped by a crash.<!----></span><br><br>The underlying cause for all three races is that CrossThreadPersistent<span class="line"><!---->The underlying cause for all three races is that CrossThreadPersistent<!----></span><br>can refer to an object whose heap has already been destroyed. When<span class="line"><!---->can refer to an object whose heap has already been destroyed. When<!----></span><br>accessed on the thread corresponding to that heap, there is no race,<span class="line"><!---->accessed on the thread corresponding to that heap, there is no race,<!----></span><br>but when accessed from a different thread, there is a period of time<span class="line"><!---->but when accessed from a different thread, there is a period of time<!----></span><br>after the heap is destroyed before the CrossThreadPersistent is<span class="line"><!---->after the heap is destroyed before the CrossThreadPersistent is<!----></span><br>cleared.<span class="line"><!---->cleared.<!----></span><br><br>1. The FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::transferred_source_ member's pointer<span class="line"><!---->1. The FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::transferred_source_ member's pointer<!----></span><br>   is accessed in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::Close. This CL adds a<span class="line"><!---->   is accessed in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::Close. This CL adds a<!----></span><br>   callback to clear the pointer in<span class="line"><!---->   callback to clear the pointer in<!----></span><br>   TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource::ContextDestroyed.<span class="line"><!---->   TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource::ContextDestroyed.<!----></span><br><br>2. The TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource constructor takes a raw<span class="line"><!---->2. The TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource constructor takes a raw<!----></span><br>   pointer to the original FrameQueueUnderlyingSource, which is<span class="line"><!---->   pointer to the original FrameQueueUnderlyingSource, which is<!----></span><br>   associated with a different thread. GC won't be able to update this<span class="line"><!---->   associated with a different thread. GC won't be able to update this<!----></span><br>   raw pointer since it's on the wrong stack. This CL changes the raw<span class="line"><!---->   raw pointer since it's on the wrong stack. This CL changes the raw<!----></span><br>   pointer to a CrossThreadPersistent which is visible to GC.<span class="line"><!---->   pointer to a CrossThreadPersistent which is visible to GC.<!----></span><br><br>3. Same as 2, but for the callstack ConnectHostCallback,<span class="line"><!---->3. Same as 2, but for the callstack ConnectHostCallback,<!----></span><br>   MediaStream(Audio|Video)TrackUnderlyingSource::OnSourceTransferStarted<span class="line"><!---->   MediaStream(Audio|Video)TrackUnderlyingSource::OnSourceTransferStarted<!----></span><br>   and FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::TransferSource.<span class="line"><!---->   and         Verified that 106.0.5249.30 (Official Build) beta (64-bit) Linux crashes within ~15s but 107.0.5286.2 (Official Build) dev (64-bit) Linux runs for 8h without crashing.<span class="line"><!---->Verified that 106.0.5249.30 (Official Build) beta (64-bit) Linux crashes within ~15s but 107.0.5286.2 (Official Build) dev (64-bit) Linux runs for 8h without crashing.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        For some reason this bug being updated to Fixed did not trigger the bot to add merge labels. While a page reload is a bit of a mitigation, it's somewhat part of a standard browser work flow and malicious web content could be crafted by an attacker to induce the user to reload, resulting in a potential oob read here. I feel like this is potentially a medium severity bug rather than a high, but given we are coming up on 106/Stable release, medium severity fixes should be backmerged to next stable at a minimum. <span class="line"><!---->For some reason this bug being updated to Fixed did not trigger the bot to add merge labels. While a page reload is a bit of a mitigation, it's somewhat part of a standard browser work flow and malicious web content could be crafted by an attacker to induce the user to reload, resulting in a potential oob read here. I feel like this is potentially a medium severity bug rather than a high, but given we are coming up on 106/Stable release, medium severity fixes should be backmerged to next stable at a minimum. <!----></span><br>Chatted with Ben off-bug and there are no issues with backmerging this to 106. Adding a merge approval label. Please backmerge ASAP this morning/today so this fix can be included in M106 Stable cut for release next week. Thank you!<span class="line"><!---->Chatted with Ben off-bug and there are no issues with backmerging this to 106. Adding a merge approval label. Please backmerge ASAP this morning/today so this fix can be included in M106 Stable cut for release next week. Thank you!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/fefd6198da317344f24d1c16ec9670cf0e93793e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/fefd6198da317344f24d1c16ec9670cf0e93793e"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/fefd6198da317344f24d1c16ec9670cf0e93793e<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>fefd6198da317344f24d1c16ec9670cf0e93793e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/fefd6198da317344f24d1c16ec9670cf0e93793e"><!---->fefd6198da317344f24d1c16ec9670cf0e93793e<!----></a><br>Author: Ben Wagner <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Ben Wagner &lt;<!----></span>benjaminwagner@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/benjaminwagner@google.com"><!---->benjaminwagner@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Sep 20 18:38:53 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Sep 20 18:38:53 2022<!----></span><br><br>[M106] Fix races in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource related to CrossThreadPersistent<span class="line"><!---->[M106] Fix races in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource related to CrossThreadPersistent<!----></span><br><br>The repro in <span class="line"><!---->The repro in <!----></span>bug 1323488<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1323488" title="memeory corruption in frame_queue_underlying_source.cc"><!---->bug 1323488<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>unfortunately does not reliably reproduce<span class="line"><!---->unfortunately does not reliably reproduce<!----></span><br>the races when run as a web test. I was also not able to repro the<span class="line"><!---->the races when run as a web test. I was also not able to repro the<!----></span><br>races in a unit test.<span class="line"><!---->races in a unit test.<!----></span><br><br>There are actually three fixes in this CL; it was easiest to fix them<span class="line"><!---->There are actually three fixes in this CL; it was easiest to fix them<!----></span><br>all together so that I can run the repro locally for an extended period<span class="line"><!---->all together so that I can run the repro locally for an extended period<!----></span><br>without it being stopped by a crash.<span class="line"><!---->without it being stopped by a crash.<!----></span><br><br>The underlying cause for all three races is that CrossThreadPersistent<span class="line"><!---->The underlying cause for all three races is that CrossThreadPersistent<!----></span><br>can refer to an object whose heap has already been destroyed. When<span class="line"><!---->can refer to an object whose heap has already been destroyed. When<!----></span><br>accessed on the thread corresponding to that heap, there is no race,<span class="line"><!---->accessed on the thread corresponding to that heap, there is no race,<!----></span><br>but when accessed from a different thread, there is a period of time<span class="line"><!---->but when accessed from a different thread, there is a period of time<!----></span><br>after the heap is destroyed before the CrossThreadPersistent is<span class="line"><!---->after the heap is destroyed before the CrossThreadPersistent is<!----></span><br>cleared.<span class="line"><!---->cleared.<!----></span><br><br>1. The FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::transferred_source_ member's pointer<span class="line"><!---->1. The FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::transferred_source_ member's pointer<!----></span><br>   is accessed in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::Close. This CL adds a<span class="line"><!---->   is accessed in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::Close. This CL adds a<!----></span><br>   callback to clear the pointer in<span class="line"><!---->   callback to clear the pointer in<!----></span><br>   TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource::ContextDestroyed.<span class="line"><!---->   TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource::ContextDestroyed.<!----></span><br><br>2. The TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource constructor takes a raw<span class="line"><!---->2. The TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource constructor takes a raw<!----></span><br>   pointer to the original FrameQueueUnderlyingSource, which is<span class="line"><!---->   pointer to the original FrameQueueUnderlyingSource, which is<!----></span><br>   associated with a different thread. GC won't be able to update this<span class="line"><!---->   associated with a different thread. GC won't be able to update this<!----></span><br>   raw pointer since it's on the wrong stack. This CL changes the raw<span class="line"><!---->   raw pointer since it's on the wrong stack. This CL changes the raw<!----></span><br>   pointer to a CrossThreadPersistent which is visible to GC.<span class="line"><!---->   pointer to a CrossThreadPersistent which is visible to GC.<!----></span><br><br>3. Same as 2, but for the callstack ConnectHostCallback,<span class="line"><!---->3. Same as 2, but for the callstack ConnectHostCallback,<!----></span><br>   MediaStream(Audio|Video)TrackUnderlyingSource::OnSourceTransferStarted<span class="line"><!---->   MediaStream(Audio|Video)TrackUnderlyingSource::OnSourceTransferStarted<!----></span><br>   and FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::TransferSource.<span class="line"><!---->   and FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::TransferSource.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit         Re <span class="line"><!---->Re <!----></span>Comment #41<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c41"><!---->Comment #41<!----></a>: I think we clear the CTP before we remove the object but you may read out the raw pointer from the CTP which gets cleared immediately afterwards. So, this should be a UAF in the worst case.<span class="line"><!---->: I think we clear the CTP before we remove the object but you may read out the raw pointer from the CTP which gets cleared immediately afterwards.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $3,000 for this report of this moderately mitigated (<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $3,000 for this report of this moderately mitigated (<!----></span>https://g.co/chrome/vrp<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://g.co/chrome/vrp"><!---->https://g.co/chrome/vrp<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> security bug based on the very tight/difficult race condition for this to result in a uaf versus a null pointer deref and the evidence of both reports of this issue being of the null pointer vs the uaf. Thank you for your efforts in reporting this issue to us!<span class="line"><!----> security bug based on the very tight/difficult race condition for this to result in a uaf versus a null pointer deref and the evidence of both reports of this issue being of the null pointer vs the uaf.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

    Send email<chops-checkbox checked="true">Send email</chops-checkbox>

              <option value="">--Please choose a project template--</option>

          </button>
        <h3 class="medium-heading">
          <span>Blocked on issues</span>

          </button>
        </h3>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        Due to an issue with the monorail wizard workflow, this issue was not originally labeled as a security bug and, therefore, this issue did not make it to the security team bug queue for triage. This wizard workflow issue was just discovered today, updating accordingly now. <span class="line"><!---->Due to an issue with the monorail wizard workflow, this issue was not originally labeled as a security bug and, therefore, this issue did not make it to the security team bug queue for triage. This wizard workflow issue was just discovered today, updating accordingly now. <!----></span><br><br>Tentatively setting these and others as security bugs for general tracking purposes and to go into actual security triage; however, there is no indication that this issue results in security consequences nor has it yet been evaluated for such.<span class="line"><!---->Tentatively setting these and others as security bugs for general tracking purposes and to go into actual security triage; however, there is no indication that this issue results in security consequences nor has it yet been evaluated for such.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Apologies for the delay; I was unexpectedly away from work.<span class="line"><!---->Apologies for the delay; I was unexpectedly away from work.<!----></span><br><br>Unfortunately the repro from the bug description (or from <span class="line"><!---->Unfortunately the repro from the bug description (or from <!----></span>comment #25<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c25"><!---->comment #25<!----></a>) is not reliable enough to make into a test, so I will need to rely on manual testing. I have also not succeeded in reproducing the issue in a unit test.<span class="line"><!---->) is not reliable enough to make into a test, so I will need to rely on manual testing. I have also not succeeded in reproducing the issue in a unit test.<!----></span><br><br>Aside from hitting some DCHECKs in various other places in Chromium, the repro causes the worker thread's heap to be destroyed while the main thread still believes that the transferred source is alive. After discussing with mlippautz@, it seems like we can fix this by clearing host_->transferred_source_ in TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource::ContextDestroyed(). I'll have to check if this is a valid fix.<span class="line"><!---->Aside from hitting some DCHECKs in various other places in Chromium, the repro causes the worker thread's heap to be destroyed while the main thread still believes that the transferred source is alive. After discussing with mlippautz@, it seems like we can fix this by clearing host_-&gt;transferred_source_ in TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource::ContextDestroyed(). I'll have to check if this is a valid fix.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb"><!---->63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb<!----></a><br>Author: Ben Wagner <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Ben Wagner &lt;<!----></span>benjaminwagner@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/benjaminwagner@google.com"><!---->benjaminwagner@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Aug 31 09:23:46 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Aug 31 09:23:46 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fix races in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource related to CrossThreadPersistent<span class="line"><!---->Fix races in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource related to CrossThreadPersistent<!----></span><br><br>The repro in <span class="line"><!---->The repro in <!----></span>bug 1323488<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1323488" title="memeory corruption in frame_queue_underlying_source.cc"><!---->bug 1323488<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>unfortunately does not reliably reproduce<span class="line"><!---->unfortunately does not reliably reproduce<!----></span><br>the races when run as a web test. I was also not able to repro the<span class="line"><!---->the races when run as a web test. I was also not able to repro the<!----></span><br>races in a unit test.<span class="line"><!---->races in a unit test.<!----></span><br><br>There are actually three fixes in this CL; it was easiest to fix them<span class="line"><!---->There are actually three fixes in this CL; it was easiest to fix them<!----></span><br>all together so that I can run the repro locally for an extended period<span class="line"><!---->all together so that I can run the repro locally for an extended period<!----></span><br>without it being stopped by a crash.<span class="line"><!---->without it being stopped by a crash.<!----></span><br><br>The underlying cause for all three races is that CrossThreadPersistent<span class="line"><!---->The underlying cause for all three races is that CrossThreadPersistent<!----></span><br>can refer to an object whose heap has already been destroyed. When<span class="line"><!---->can refer to an object whose heap has already been destroyed. When<!----></span><br>accessed on the thread corresponding to that heap, there is no race,<span class="line"><!---->accessed on the thread corresponding to that heap, there is no race,<!----></span><br>but when accessed from a different thread, there is a period of time<span class="line"><!---->but when accessed from a different thread, there is a period of time<!----></span><br>after the heap is destroyed before the CrossThreadPersistent is<span class="line"><!---->after the heap is destroyed before the CrossThreadPersistent is<!----></span><br>cleared.<span class="line"><!---->cleared.<!----></span><br><br>1. The FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::transferred_source_ member's pointer<span class="line"><!---->1. The FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::transferred_source_ member's pointer<!----></span><br>   is accessed in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::Close. This CL adds a<span class="line"><!---->   is accessed in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::Close. This CL adds a<!----></span><br>   callback to clear the pointer in<span class="line"><!---->   callback to clear the pointer in<!----></span><br>   TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource::ContextDestroyed.<span class="line"><!---->   TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource::ContextDestroyed.<!----></span><br><br>2. The TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource constructor takes a raw<span class="line"><!---->2. The TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource constructor takes a raw<!----></span><br>   pointer to the original FrameQueueUnderlyingSource, which is<span class="line"><!---->   pointer to the original FrameQueueUnderlyingSource, which is<!----></span><br>   associated with a different thread. GC won't be able to update this<span class="line"><!---->   associated with a different thread. GC won't be able to update this<!----></span><br>   raw pointer since it's on the wrong stack. This CL changes the raw<span class="line"><!---->   raw pointer since it's on the wrong stack. This CL changes the raw<!----></span><br>   pointer to a CrossThreadPersistent which is visible to GC.<span class="line"><!---->   pointer to a CrossThreadPersistent which is visible to GC.<!----></span><br><br>3. Same as 2, but for the callstack ConnectHostCallback,<span class="line"><!---->3. Same as 2, but for the callstack ConnectHostCallback,<!----></span><br>   MediaStream(Audio|Video)TrackUnderlyingSource::OnSourceTransferStarted<span class="line"><!---->   MediaStream(Audio|Video)TrackUnderlyingSource::OnSourceTransferStarted<!----></span><br>   and FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::TransferSource.<span class="line"><!---->   and FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::TransferSource.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1323488<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1323488" title="memeory corruption in         For some reason this bug being updated to Fixed did not trigger the bot to add merge labels. While a page reload is a bit of a mitigation, it's somewhat part of a standard browser work flow and malicious web content could be crafted by an attacker to induce the user to reload, resulting in a potential oob read here. I feel like this is potentially a medium severity bug rather than a high, but given we are coming up on 106/Stable release, medium severity fixes should be backmerged to next stable at a minimum. <span class="line"><!---->For some reason this bug being updated to Fixed did not trigger the bot to add merge labels. While a page reload is a bit of a mitigation, it's somewhat part of a standard browser work flow and malicious web content could be crafted by an attacker to induce the user to reload, resulting in a potential oob read here. I feel like this is potentially a medium severity bug rather than a high, but given we are coming up on 106/Stable release, medium severity fixes should be backmerged to next stable at a minimum. <!----></span><br>Chatted with Ben off-bug and there are no issues with backmerging this to 106. Adding a merge approval label. Please backmerge ASAP this morning/today so this fix can be included in M106 Stable cut for release next week. Thank you!<span class="line"><!---->Chatted with Ben off-bug and there are no issues with backmerging this to 106. Adding a merge approval label. Please backmerge ASAP this morning/today so this fix can be included in M106 Stable cut for release next week. Thank you!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/fefd6198da317344f24d1c16ec9670cf0e93793e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/fefd6198da317344f24d1c16ec9670cf0e93793e"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/fefd6198da317344f24d1c16ec9670cf0e93793e<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>fefd6198da317344f24d1c16ec9670cf0e93793e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/fefd6198da317344f24d1c16ec9670cf0e93793e"><!---->fefd6198da317344f24d1c16ec9670cf0e93793e<!----></a><br>Author: Ben Wagner <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Ben Wagner &lt;<!----></span>benjaminwagner@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/benjaminwagner@google.com"><!---->benjaminwagner@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Sep 20 18:38:53 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Sep 20 18:38:53 2022<!----></span><br><br>[M106] Fix races in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource related to CrossThreadPersistent<span class="line"><!---->[M106] Fix races in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource related to CrossThreadPersistent<!----></span><br><br>The repro in <span class="line"><!---->The repro in <!----></span>bug 1323488<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1323488" title="memeory corruption in frame_queue_underlying_source.cc"><!---->bug 1323488<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>unfortunately does not reliably reproduce<span class="line"><!---->unfortunately does not reliably reproduce<!----></span><br>the races when run as a web test. I was also not able to repro the<span class="line"><!---->the races when run as a web test. I was also not able to repro the<!----></span><br>races in a unit test.<span class="line"><!---->races in a unit test.<!----></span><br><br>There are actually three fixes in this CL; it was easiest to fix them<span class="line"><!---->There are actually three fixes in this CL; it was easiest to fix them<!----></span><br>all together so that I can run the repro locally for an extended period<span class="line"><!---->all together so that I can run the repro locally for an extended period<!----></span><br>without it being stopped by a crash.<span class="line"><!---->without it being stopped by a crash.<!----></span><br><br>The underlying cause for all three races is that CrossThreadPersistent<span class="line"><!---->The underlying cause for all three races is that CrossThreadPersistent<!----></span><br>can refer to an object whose heap has already been destroyed. When<span class="line"><!---->can refer to an object whose heap has already been destroyed. When<!----></span><br>accessed on the thread corresponding to that heap, there is no race,<span class="line"><!---->accessed on the thread corresponding to that heap, there is no race,<!----></span><br>but when accessed from a different thread, there is a period of time<span class="line"><!---->but when accessed from a different thread, there is a period of time<!----></span><br>after the heap is destroyed before the CrossThreadPersistent is<span class="line"><!---->after the heap is destroyed before the CrossThreadPersistent is<!----></span><br>cleared.<span class="line"><!---->cleared.<!----></span><br><br>1. The FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::transferred_source_ member's pointer<span class="line"><!---->1. The FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::transferred_source_ member's pointer<!----></span><br>   is accessed in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::Close. This CL adds a<span class="line"><!---->   is accessed in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::Close. This CL adds a<!----></span><br>   callback to clear the pointer in<span class="line"><!---->   callback to clear the pointer in<!----></span><br>   TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource::ContextDestroyed.<span class="line"><!---->   TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource::ContextDestroyed.<!----></span><br><br>2. The TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource constructor takes a raw<span class="line"><!---->2. The TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource constructor takes a raw<!----></span><br>   pointer to the original FrameQueueUnderlyingSource, which is<span class="line"><!---->   pointer to the original FrameQueueUnderlyingSource, which is<!----></span><br>   associated with a different thread. GC won't be able to update this<span class="line"><!---->   associated with a different thread. GC won't be able to update this<!----></span><br>   raw pointer since it's on the wrong stack. This CL changes the raw<span class="line"><!---->   raw pointer since it's on the wrong stack. This CL changes the raw<!----></span><br>   pointer to a CrossThreadPersistent which is visible to GC.<span class="line"><!---->   pointer to a CrossThreadPersistent which is visible to GC.<!----></span><br><br>3. Same as 2, but for the callstack ConnectHostCallback,<span class="line"><!---->3. Same as 2, but for the callstack ConnectHostCallback,<!----></span><br>   MediaStream(Audio|Video)TrackUnderlyingSource::OnSourceTransferStarted<span class="line"><!---->   MediaStream(Audio|Video)TrackUnderlyingSource::OnSourceTransferStarted<!----></span><br>   and FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::TransferSource.<span class="line"><!---->   and FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::TransferSource.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         Re <span class="line"><!---->Re <!----></span>Comment #41<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c41"><!---->Comment #41<!----></a>: I think we clear the CTP before we remove the object but you may read out the raw pointer from the CTP which gets cleared immediately afterwards. So, this should be a UAF in the worst case.<span class="line"><!---->: I think we clear the CTP before we remove the object but you may read out the raw pointer from the CTP which gets cleared immediately afterwards.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $3,000 for this report of this moderately mitigated (<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $3,000 for this report of this moderately mitigated (<!----></span>https://g.co/chrome/vrp<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://g.co/chrome/vrp"><!---->https://g.co/chrome/vrp<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> security bug based on the very tight/difficult race condition for this to result in a uaf versus a null pointer deref and the evidence of both reports of this issue being of the null pointer vs the uaf. Thank you for your efforts in reporting this issue to us!<span class="line"><!----> security bug based on the very tight/difficult race condition for this to result in a uaf versus a null pointer deref and the evidence of both reports of this issue being of the null pointer vs the uaf.         Due to an issue with the monorail wizard workflow, this issue was not originally labeled as a security bug and, therefore, this issue did not make it to the security team bug queue for triage. This wizard workflow issue was just discovered today, updating accordingly now. <span class="line"><!---->Due to an issue with the monorail wizard workflow, this issue was not originally labeled as a security bug and, therefore, this issue did not make it to the security team bug queue for triage. This wizard workflow issue was just discovered today, updating accordingly now. <!----></span><br><br>Tentatively setting these and others as security bugs for general tracking purposes and to go into actual security triage; however, there is no indication that this issue results in security consequences nor has it yet been evaluated for such.<span class="line"><!---->Tentatively setting these and others as security bugs for general tracking purposes and to go into actual security triage; however, there is no indication that this issue results in security consequences nor has it yet been evaluated for such.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Apologies for the delay; I was unexpectedly away from work.<span class="line"><!---->Apologies for the delay; I was unexpectedly away from work.<!----></span><br><br>Unfortunately the repro from the bug description (or from <span class="line"><!---->Unfortunately the repro from the bug description (or from <!----></span>comment #25<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c25"><!---->comment #25<!----></a>) is not reliable enough to make into a test, so I will need to rely on manual testing. I have also not succeeded in reproducing the issue in a unit test.<span class="line"><!---->) is not reliable enough to make into a test, so I will need to rely on manual testing. I have also not succeeded in reproducing the issue in a unit test.<!----></span><br><br>Aside from hitting some DCHECKs in various other places in Chromium, the repro causes the worker thread's heap to be destroyed while the main thread still believes that the transferred source is alive. After discussing with mlippautz@, it seems like we can fix this by clearing host_->transferred_source_ in TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource::ContextDestroyed(). I'll have to check if this is a valid fix.<span class="line"><!---->Aside from hitting some DCHECKs in various other places in Chromium, the repro causes the worker thread's heap to be destroyed while the main thread still believes that the transferred source is alive. After discussing with mlippautz@, it seems like we can fix this by clearing host_-&gt;transferred_source_ in TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource::ContextDestroyed(). I'll have to check if this is a valid fix.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb"><!---->63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb<!----></a><br>Author: Ben Wagner <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Ben Wagner &lt;<!----></span>benjaminwagner@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/benjaminwagner@google.com"><!---->benjaminwagner@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Aug 31 09:23:46 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Aug 31 09:23:46 2022<!----></span><br><br>Fix races in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource related to CrossThreadPersistent<span class="line"><!---->Fix races in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource related to CrossThreadPersistent<!----></span><br><br>The repro in <span class="line"><!---->The repro in <!----></span>bug 1323488<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1323488" title="memeory corruption in frame_queue_underlying_source.cc"><!---->bug 1323488<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>unfortunately does not reliably reproduce<span class="line"><!---->unfortunately does not reliably reproduce<!----></span><br>the races when run as a web test. I was also not able to repro the<span class="line"><!---->the races when run as a web test. I was also not able to repro the<!----></span><br>races in a unit test.<span class="line"><!---->races in a unit test.<!----></span><br><br>There are actually three fixes in this CL; it was easiest to fix them<span class="line"><!---->There are actually three fixes in this CL; it was easiest to fix them<!----></span><br>all together so that I can run the repro locally for an extended period<span class="line"><!---->all together so that I can run the repro locally for an extended period<!----></span><br>without it being stopped by a crash.<span class="line"><!---->without it being stopped by a crash.<!----></span><br><br>The underlying cause for all three races is that CrossThreadPersistent<span class="line"><!---->The underlying cause for all three races is that CrossThreadPersistent<!----></span><br>can refer to an object whose heap has already been destroyed. When<span class="line"><!---->can refer to an object whose heap has already been destroyed. When<!----></span><br>accessed on the thread corresponding to that heap, there is no race,<span class="line"><!---->accessed on the thread corresponding to that heap, there is no race,<!----></span><br>but when accessed from a different thread, there is a period of time<span class="line"><!---->but when accessed from a different thread, there is a period of time<!----></span><br>after the heap is destroyed before the CrossThreadPersistent is<span class="line"><!---->after the heap is destroyed before the CrossThreadPersistent is<!----></span><br>cleared.<span class="line"><!---->cleared.<!----></span><br><br>1. The FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::transferred_source_ member's pointer<span class="line"><!---->1. The FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::transferred_source_ member's pointer<!----></span><br>   is accessed in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::Close. This CL adds a<span class="line"><!---->   is accessed in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::Close. This CL adds a<!----></span><br>   callback to clear the pointer in<span class="line"><!---->   callback to clear the pointer in<!----></span><br>   TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource::ContextDestroyed.<span class="line"><!---->   TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource::ContextDestroyed.<!----></span><br><br>2. The TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource constructor takes a raw<span class="line"><!---->2. The TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource constructor takes a raw<!----></span><br>   pointer to the original FrameQueueUnderlyingSource, which is<span class="line"><!---->   pointer to the original FrameQueueUnderlyingSource, which is<!----></span><br>   associated with a different thread. GC won't be able to update this<span class="line"><!---->   associated with a different thread. GC won't be able to update this<!----></span><br>   raw pointer since it's on the wrong stack. This CL changes the raw<span class="line"><!---->   raw pointer since it's on the wrong stack. This CL changes the raw<!----></span><br>   pointer to a CrossThreadPersistent which is visible to GC.<span class="line"><!---->   pointer to a CrossThreadPersistent which is visible to GC.<!----></span><br><br>3. Same as 2, but for the callstack ConnectHostCallback,<span class="line"><!---->3. Same as 2, but for the callstack ConnectHostCallback,<!----></span><br>   MediaStream(Audio|Video)TrackUnderlyingSource::OnSourceTransferStarted<span class="line"><!---->   MediaStream(Audio|Video)TrackUnderlyingSource::OnSourceTransferStarted<!----></span><br>   and FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::TransferSource.<span class="line"><!---->   and FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::TransferSource.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1323488<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1323488" title="memeory corruption in         For some reason this bug being updated to Fixed did not trigger the bot to add merge labels. While a page reload is a bit of a mitigation, it's somewhat part of a standard browser work flow and malicious web content could be crafted by an attacker to induce the user to reload, resulting in a potential oob read here. I feel like this is potentially a medium severity bug rather than a high, but given we are coming up on 106/Stable release, medium severity fixes should be backmerged to next stable at a minimum. <span class="line"><!---->For some reason this bug being updated to Fixed did not trigger the bot to add merge labels. While a page reload is a bit of a mitigation, it's somewhat part of a standard browser work flow and malicious web content could be crafted by an attacker to induce the user to reload, resulting in a potential oob read here. I feel like this is potentially a medium severity bug rather than a high, but given we are coming up on 106/Stable release, medium severity fixes should be backmerged to next stable at a minimum. <!----></span><br>Chatted with Ben off-bug and there are no issues with backmerging this to 106. Adding a merge approval label. Please backmerge ASAP this morning/today so this fix can be included in M106 Stable cut for release next week. Thank you!<span class="line"><!---->Chatted with Ben off-bug and there are no issues with backmerging this to 106. Adding a merge approval label. Please backmerge ASAP this morning/today so this fix can be included in M106 Stable cut for release next week. Thank you!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/fefd6198da317344f24d1c16ec9670cf0e93793e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/fefd6198da317344f24d1c16ec9670cf0e93793e"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/fefd6198da317344f24d1c16ec9670cf0e93793e<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>fefd6198da317344f24d1c16ec9670cf0e93793e<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/fefd6198da317344f24d1c16ec9670cf0e93793e"><!---->fefd6198da317344f24d1c16ec9670cf0e93793e<!----></a><br>Author: Ben Wagner <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Ben Wagner &lt;<!----></span>benjaminwagner@google.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/benjaminwagner@google.com"><!---->benjaminwagner@google.com<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Sep 20 18:38:53 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Sep 20 18:38:53 2022<!----></span><br><br>[M106] Fix races in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource related to CrossThreadPersistent<span class="line"><!---->[M106] Fix races in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource related to CrossThreadPersistent<!----></span><br><br>The repro in <span class="line"><!---->The repro in <!----></span>bug 1323488<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1323488" title="memeory corruption in frame_queue_underlying_source.cc"><!---->bug 1323488<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>unfortunately does not reliably reproduce<span class="line"><!---->unfortunately does not reliably reproduce<!----></span><br>the races when run as a web test. I was also not able to repro the<span class="line"><!---->the races when run as a web test. I was also not able to repro the<!----></span><br>races in a unit test.<span class="line"><!---->races in a unit test.<!----></span><br><br>There are actually three fixes in this CL; it was easiest to fix them<span class="line"><!---->There are actually three fixes in this CL; it was easiest to fix them<!----></span><br>all together so that I can run the repro locally for an extended period<span class="line"><!---->all together so that I can run the repro locally for an extended period<!----></span><br>without it being stopped by a crash.<span class="line"><!---->without it being stopped by a crash.<!----></span><br><br>The underlying cause for all three races is that CrossThreadPersistent<span class="line"><!---->The underlying cause for all three races is that CrossThreadPersistent<!----></span><br>can refer to an object whose heap has already been destroyed. When<span class="line"><!---->can refer to an object whose heap has already been destroyed. When<!----></span><br>accessed on the thread corresponding to that heap, there is no race,<span class="line"><!---->accessed on the thread corresponding to that heap, there is no race,<!----></span><br>but when accessed from a different thread, there is a period of time<span class="line"><!---->but when accessed from a different thread, there is a period of time<!----></span><br>after the heap is destroyed before the CrossThreadPersistent is<span class="line"><!---->after the heap is destroyed before the CrossThreadPersistent is<!----></span><br>cleared.<span class="line"><!---->cleared.<!----></span><br><br>1. The FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::transferred_source_ member's pointer<span class="line"><!---->1. The FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::transferred_source_ member's pointer<!----></span><br>   is accessed in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::Close. This CL adds a<span class="line"><!---->   is accessed in FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::Close. This CL adds a<!----></span><br>   callback to clear the pointer in<span class="line"><!---->   callback to clear the pointer in<!----></span><br>   TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource::ContextDestroyed.<span class="line"><!---->   TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource::ContextDestroyed.<!----></span><br><br>2. The TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource constructor takes a raw<span class="line"><!---->2. The TransferredFrameQueueUnderlyingSource constructor takes a raw<!----></span><br>   pointer to the original FrameQueueUnderlyingSource, which is<span class="line"><!---->   pointer to the original FrameQueueUnderlyingSource, which is<!----></span><br>   associated with a different thread. GC won't be able to update this<span class="line"><!---->   associated with a different thread. GC won't be able to update this<!----></span><br>   raw pointer since it's on the wrong stack. This CL changes the raw<span class="line"><!---->   raw pointer since it's on the wrong stack. This CL changes the raw<!----></span><br>   pointer to a CrossThreadPersistent which is visible to GC.<span class="line"><!---->   pointer to a CrossThreadPersistent which is visible to GC.<!----></span><br><br>3. Same as 2, but for the callstack ConnectHostCallback,<span class="line"><!---->3. Same as 2, but for the callstack ConnectHostCallback,<!----></span><br>   MediaStream(Audio|Video)TrackUnderlyingSource::OnSourceTransferStarted<span class="line"><!---->   MediaStream(Audio|Video)TrackUnderlyingSource::OnSourceTransferStarted<!----></span><br>   and FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::TransferSource.<span class="line"><!---->   and FrameQueueUnderlyingSource::TransferSource.<!----></span><br><br>(cherry picked from commit <span class="line"><!---->(cherry picked from commit <!----></span>63ce9c40e1a67395278dfc70ecfb545a818747bb<a class="undefined" target="_blank"         Re <span class="line"><!---->Re <!----></span>Comment #41<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c41"><!---->Comment #41<!----></a>: I think we clear the CTP before we remove the object but you may read out the raw pointer from the CTP which gets cleared immediately afterwards. So, this should be a UAF in the worst case.<span class="line"><!---->: I think we clear the CTP before we remove the object but you may read out the raw pointer from the CTP which gets cleared immediately afterwards.
